properties.areaDesc: Central and Southwest Mountains; Southwest Wyoming; Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Southern Utah Mountains; Western Uinta Mountains; Wasatch Mountain Valleys; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 2:47PM MST until February 4 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20
inches is expected across the mountains, with 5 to 10 inches
across the Wasatch Back and southwest Wyoming. Locally higher
amounts are possible.

* WHERE...In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. In Utah, Wasatch
Mountain Valleys, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch
Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains, Wasatch
Plateau/Book Cliffs, Central Mountains and Southern Mountains.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult across the region
Sunday night through Monday, with the Monday morning commute
being significantly impacted.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong cold front will bring a band of
heavy snow beginning late Sunday evening across northwest Utah,
then spreading south through the remainder of the area Sunday
night. Snow will continue into the day Monday, along with much
colder temperatures.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
